util

Class Common

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Common

  • public class Common
extends Object
    This class contains static methods that are generally useful and may be used by multiple other classes.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

      • createSublist

        public static ArrayList<Double> createSublist(double[] oldArray,
                                              int[] indices)
        Given an array of doubles, returns only the elements located at the specified indices. Creates a new list but doesn't perform a deep copy of the elements.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - The array to copy from.
        indices - The indexes of the array to be kept.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList that contains only the specified elements.

      • createSublist

        public static ArrayList<Integer> createSublist(int[] oldArray,
                                               int[] indices)
        Given an array of integers, returns only the elements located at the specified indices. Creates a new list but doesn't perform a deep copy of the elements.
        Parameters:
        oldArray - The array to copy from.
        indices - The indexes of the array to be kept.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList that contains only the specified elements.

      • binary_search_max

        public static int binary_search_max(List<DP_State_Node> stage,
                                    int attr_index,
                                    double max_val,
                                    boolean inclusive)
        Binary search for the maximum element that is less than a max value on a stage of DP that corresponds to the tuples of a relation (i.e., @link{entities.paths.DP_State_Node#state_info} is @link{entities.Tuple}). The attribute whose value we are searching for is specified by its index.
        Parameters:
        stage - The (sorted) list of nodes to be searched.
        attr_index - The index of the attributes that will be used for searching.
        max_val - The maximum value we are searching for.
        inclusive - Indicates whether we want values equal to max_val to be returned.
        Returns:
        The largest index whose value is less than (or equal to if inclusive) to the specified maximum value or -1 if no element satisfies the requirement.

      • binary_search_min

        public static int binary_search_min(List<DP_State_Node> stage,
                                    int attr_index,
                                    double min_val,
                                    boolean inclusive)
        Binary search for the minimum element that is greater than a min value on a stage of DP that corresponds to the tuples of a relation (i.e., @link{entities.paths.DP_State_Node#state_info} is @link{entities.Tuple}). The attribute whose value we are searching for is specified by its index.
        Parameters:
        stage - The (sorted) list of nodes to be searched.
        attr_index - The index of the attributes that will be used for searching.
        min_val - The minimum value we are searching for.
        inclusive - Indicates whether we want values equal to min_value to be returned.
        Returns:
        The smallest index whose value is greater than (or equal to if inclusive) to the specified minimum value or -1 if no element satisfies the requirement.

      • sort_stage

        public static void sort_stage(List<DP_State_Node> stage,
                              int attr_index)
        Sorts the nodes of a stage of DP that corresponds to the tuples of a relation (i.e., @link{entities.paths.DP_State_Node#state_info} is @link{entities.Tuple}). The attribute for sorting is specified by its index.
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage to be sorted.
        attr_index - The index of the attributes that will be used for sorting.

      • hash_stage

        public static HashMap<List<Double>,List<DP_State_Node>> hash_stage(List<DP_State_Node> stage,
                                                                   int[] join_attributes)
        Hashes the nodes of a stage of DP that corresponds to the tuples of a relation (i.e., @link{entities.paths.DP_State_Node#state_info} is @link{entities.Tuple}). The key is a list of attributes of the tuples that are associated with the nodes.
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage to be hashed.
        join_attributes - The indexes of the attributes that will be used as the key.
        Returns:
        HashMap, List>

      • split_by_distinct

        public static List<org.javatuples.Pair<List<DP_State_Node>,List<DP_State_Node>>> split_by_distinct(List<DP_State_Node> left,
                                                                                                   List<DP_State_Node> right,
                                                                                                   Join_Predicate inequality,
                                                                                                   int no_partitions,
                                                                                                   int max_values_per_partition)
        For 2 stages of DP that correspond to the tuples of relations, splits the left-right tuples into multiple partitions according to the inequality condition attributes. The left and right tuples have to be sorted beforehand and the number of distinct values has to be provided. The resulting partitions satisfy the following:
        • Each partition has about the same number of distinct values.
        • The partitions are sorted both locally and globally.
        The resulting list doesn't allocate new lists of nodes. Instead, views of the original list as sublists are used.
        Parameters:
        left - The first (sorted) subset of a relation/stage.
        right - The second (sorted) subset of a relation/stage.
        inequality - A single inequality predicate.
        no_partitions - The desired number of partitions.
        max_values_per_partition - The desired distinct values contained in each partition. Any remaining ones will be assigned to the last partition.
        Returns:
        List, List>> A partitioning of the nodes as a list of left-right pairs.

      • count_distinct_vals

        public static int count_distinct_vals(List<DP_State_Node> stage1,
                                      List<DP_State_Node> stage2,
                                      int idx1,
                                      int idx2,
                                      double offset2)
        Given two stages of DP that correspond to relations, counts the number of distinct values of the tuples. The attributes whose values we want to count are specified by their indexes. We also allow a real number to be added as an offset to the values of one of the stages.
        Parameters:
        stage1 - The first stage.
        stage2 - The second stage.
        idx1 - The index of the attribute whose values we count for the first stage.
        idx2 - The index of the attribute whose values we count for the second stage.
        offset2 - An offset to be added to the values of the second stage.
